TopicTitle: KBS broadcast of Bill Kerbals first steps on the Mun

Articles.Content:
I saw a lot of great videos the last few days, so I decided to give it a whirl myself. Sorry for the poor quality of the video, I need to work on some things, and I was going for speed of delivery over quality.

Anybody want to help me out on getting better stationary pictures from outside the craft? I used the camera attachments plug-in, but I can\'t really get good distance from the craft, and I can\'t angle it very well.

If you can\'t understand it ... I added some CC captions to translate the Kerbal language. This also pretty accurately depicts how my first Mun landing actually went.

KBS Broadcast of the first steps on the Mun

I hope noone saw that...

I hate to tell you that every kerbal in the world saw that.

Son of a...

I\'m okay!
Haha, really nice video!! Great job! Keep it up!

Awesome fun! Your comment about video quality, The camera distance and angle, if you want to do complex camera work, you can use the damned robotics to set up camera arms, it can help alot, then you can get rotations, angles, extensions, etc.

Very cute. Is that Walter Kerkite?

Yeah, I actually had him added to the video tags. Was going to make a nametag for the desk but forgot.
The Gloriously Perfected art of being Kerbal is hard to perfect, i\'d say that you got it right on the dot. Excellent and hilariously done, great job Comrade. 8)
I have to say I even enjoyed the newscaster\'s animation. Well done!
